subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 4.0 release candidate 2
msgSnippet: ... This sounds very useful. It s a real pain that I don t have much time to look at properly it at the moment, though I ll do what I can. In
messageBody:
<snip>

> To support these goals, we needed the following concepts:
>
> - Runner. An extension to JUnit will likely define a custom
> subclass of Runner.
> - Plan. Each Runner must report a Plan, a hierarchical tree
> of the names of the tests it will run. Test events are
> reported with respect to leaves in this tree.
> - Request. A Request is a specification of the desired tests
> to be run. Extensions may also define custom subclasses of
> Request, in order to, for example, read tests to be run out
> of an XML file--if you think that's a good idea. :-)

This sounds very useful. It's a real pain that I don't have much
time to look at properly it at the moment, though I'll do what I can.

In particular, when writing my own parameterisation which allowed
parameterisation on a per test-method basis, I kept running into this
kind of issue, in terms of how I'd "explain" to a unit test UI what was
going to be run etc.

Unfortunately I can't (currently) release the source of my
investigations, but I'll try to apply the code I'd written to the new
Runner/Plan/Request architecture and let you know how I get on.

Jon
